results.title: The Nanny
results.creator_credit: Seth Holt, Jimmy Sangster and Seven Arts-Hammer Film Production
results.brief_description: Bette Davis is mesmerizing as a seemingly devoted, long-suffering Nanny. Ten year old Joey (William Dix) is accused of drowning his younger sister in the bath and is institutionalised for therapy despite claiming that the Nanny was responsible. When he returns home suspicion is aroused when his mother (Wendy Craig) is poisoned and his Aunt suddenly dies. Joey continues to insist the Nanny is responsible and life turns into a deft cat-and-mouse game between the shady woman and her young charge. Co-starring Jill Bennett, James Villiers and Pamela Franklin. Based on the novel “The Nanny” by Evelyn Piper.

results.title: Body Melt
results.creator_credit: Philip Brophy, Daniel Scharf, Rod Bishop, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission and 1 for Dumb Films
results.brief_description: Something weird is happening in suburban Pebbles Court, Homesville. The residents are unknowingly part of a diabolical experiment with a radical ‘90’s body drug.

constellations_other.name: Suburban scenes (Lisa McCune)
constellations_other.description: Lisa McCune is best known for her role as Constable Maggie Doyle in the television series Blue Heelers (1994–2006). In addition to showing the day-to-day lives of police in a small Victorian town, the series explores the various dynamics of suburbia—a theme present throughout the whole of screen media.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Brophy, Daniel Scharf, Rod Bishop, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission and 1 for Dumb Films
results.description: Something weird is happening in suburban Pebbles Court, Homesville. The residents are unknowingly part of a diabolical experiment with a radical ‘90’s body drug. Some will survive but most will not! The first phase is hallucinogenic, the second phase is glandular and the third phase is Body Melt! “An inventive and laudably tasteless journey into the surreal” Sight & Sound (UK). “Packs more mucous, phlegm, puke, snot, slime and spit than you ever thought possible” Starburst (UK). If you enjoyed “Salt, saliva, sweat and sperm” in the ‘80’s by the same producers and director, then this is the ‘90’S experience you have been craving! Based on four short stories by Philip Brophy. Starring Gerard Kennedy, Ian Smith, Andrew Daddo, Lisa McCune, Brett Climo, Vince Gil and William McInnes.

results.title: Ladyhawke (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Lauren Shuler, Warner Bros Pictures and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A haunting tale of magic and mysticism set in an age of enchantment and adventure. Navarre (Rutger Hauer) and Isabeau (Michelle Pfeiffer) are two lovers, condemned to spend eternity together - yet never touch, transformed by the spell of the corrupt Bishop Aquila. Aided by the young renegade thief, “Phillipe the mouse” (Matthew Broderick) and defrocked priest, Imperius (Leo McKern), they must find a moment in time when night and day are one - and evil consumes itself to break the spell.

results.title: Proof (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House and House and Moorhouse Films
results.brief_description: Winner of 7 Australian Film Institute awards, “Proof” is a provocative and engrossing film about a man’s obsessive search for truth. Martin (Hugo Weaving) has been blind from birth. He trusts no-one, except for the camera which has replaced his eyes. His photos are proof that the world he senses is the same as other people see. Then he meets a young kitchen hand, Andy, whose honesty and kindness allow Martin to trust for the first time - until Martin’s jealous housekeeper, Celia, sets out to destroy this relationship. Written and directed by Jocelyn Moorhouse who won a 1992 Victorian Premier’s Literary Award for her screenplay.

results.title: Speed (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jan De Bont, Mark Gordon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Fast moving, action packed and relentless, ‘Speed’ transports the viewer into a world gone mad, as a terrorist “mad bomber” (Dennis Hopper) holds a bus load of innocent passengers to ransom. Keanu Reeves is a SWAT specialist who must ensure that the bus keeps speeding through the streets of Los Angeles at no less than 50mph if the passengers are to stay alive. Co-starring Sandra Bullock and Jeff Daniels.

results.title: Chaplin (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Mario Kassar and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Brilliant, enigmatic, beloved, Charlie Chaplin made more people laugh than anyone else in history. His story and the story of filmmaking are inextricably linked and brought to the screen in Richard Attenborough’s modern masterpiece. This truly magnificent film features one of the finest casts from the world of film and includes: Dan Aykroyd, Geraldine Chaplin, Anthony Hopkins, Marisa Tomei, Kevin Kline and James Woods. This is the story of how this master entertainer survived a deprived and tragic childhood and then transformed such poverty into humour cherished by all.

results.title: The Crying game (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Stephen Woolley, Nippon Film Development & Finance, Euro Trustees, Channel Four and Palace Films
results.brief_description: Full of surprises, this film did more than win extraordinary critical acclaim throughout the world. It upstaged the competition by receiving six Academy Award nominations and an Oscar for Best Screenplay. Set in Ireland, this spellbinding thriller involves a black British soldier, Jody (Forest Whittaker), who befriends his reluctant IRA captor, Fergus (Stephen Rea). When Jody is killed in an ambush, Fergus fulfills his dying wish - to find his girlfriend Dil (Jaye Davidson) in England. When Fergus and Dil become romantically involved, the crying game begins. Electrifying and seductive, this is the movie that had everyone talking. Co-starring Miranda Richardson.

results.title: The Last of the Mohicans (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Mann, Hunt Lowry and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: Daniel Day-Lewis and Madeleine Stowe star in this adaptation of James Fenimore Cooper’s classic tale of a white man raised by Mohicans and who becomes embroiled in a clash between two strong and rival nations. Set in the American colonies during the bitter Anglo-French war of 1757, Daniel Day-Lewis as Hawkeye brings strength and passion to the role. This film is typical of the epic romantic sagas with its fast action, breathtaking scenery, spectacular battle scenes and a superb cast.

results.title: The Silver brumby (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Tatoulis, Colin South and Media World Features
results.brief_description: Based on Elyne Mitchell’s famous novel, “The Silver Brumby” is set in the Australian Alps, where a rogue stallion is king of the mob of horses which roam the awesome landscape. For years, the mountain men have tried to capture him, but with no success. One horseman is determined to succeed where others have failed and embarks on an unforgettable adventure. Starring Russell Crowe, Caroline Goodall and Ami Daemion.

results.title: Fried green tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jordan Kerner, Jon Avnet, Fried Green Tomatoes Productions, Electric Shadow Productions, ACT III Communications and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Dowdy housewife Evelyn Cooch meets an elderly lady, Ninny Threadgoode, who transports Evelyn back to the 1930’s by weaving a magical tale about two women, gentle Ruth, and headstrong Idgie, who ran the Whistle Stop Cafe during the Depression. Idgie’s and Ruth’s friendship defied all odds, and remained strong even when the scandal of murder threatened to separate them. Academy Award winners Jessica Tandy and Kathy Bates play Ninny and Evelyn, while Mary-Louise Parker and Mary Stuart Masterton give excellent performances as the friends Ruth and Idgie. Based upon the novel by Fannie Flagg who also wrote the screenplay.
